alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Sampson; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:31PM EDT until August 15 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR WAYNE...NORTHEASTERN SAMPSON...SOUTHERN WILSON AND SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 630 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fremont to 6 miles northwest of Goldsboro to 13 miles southeast of Dunn, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Goldsboro, Smithfield, Mount Olive, Fremont, Micro, Selma, Pine Level, Kenly, Princeton and Lucama. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
